news title: Himalayan avalanche kills seven Indian soldiers near border with China
content summary:
MUMBAI (REUTERS) - A Himalayan avalanche killed seven Indian soldiers in the northeastern state of Arunachal Pradesh near the China border, a defence ministry spokesman said on Tuesday (Feb 8).
The avalanche struck in the Kameng region on Sunday.
Bodies of all seven individuals have been recovered from the avalanche site," Lieutenant Colonel Harsh Wardhan Pande, a spokesman for the Ministry of Defence in the northeast, said in a statement on Tuesday.
The Kameng region is at an altitude of 14,500 feet and had seen heavy snowfall in the last few days, he said.
Arunachal shares a border with Tibet.

NEW DELHI (REUTERS) - A Himalayan avalanche trapped a patrol team of seven Indian Army personnel in the north-eastern state of Arunachal Pradesh near China on Sunday and they have yet to be rescued, a defence ministry official said on Monday (Feb 7).

SALT LAKE CITY (NYTIMES) - Four back-country skiers were killed on Saturday (Feb 6) in an avalanche in Utah, police said.
It was the deadliest avalanche in the United States since May 2014, when six climbers were killed on Mount Rainier in Washington, according to the Colorado Avalanche Information Centre.

news title: Dogs' barking prompts owners' rescue from Swiss avalanche
content summary:
VIENNA (REUTERS) - Two people caught in an avalanche in Switzerland were rescued after their dogs barked for help, attracting the attention of nearby snow-shoers who were able to dig them out, air ambulance service Rega said on Sunday (Jan 31).
"Their dogs, who were not buried by the masses of snow, drew attention to themselves by barking loudly," the statement said.
"The dogs attracted the attention of a group of snow-shoers who were some distance away in the same valley but had not witnessed the avalanche."
Roughly 15-20 minutes after the avalanche, the group was at the scene, where one of the avalanche victims' hands was visible; the other person was buried entirely, Rega said.
Rega did not say how many dogs were involved or what breed they were.

news title: 'Miracle' escape for man trapped in Alps avalanche
content summary:
FRANCE (AFP) - A man out walking with his family in the French Alps has made a miraculous escape from an avalanche after spending more than two and a half hours trapped under snow, rescuers said.
The 50-year-old father was snowshoeing near the high-altitude Val d'Isere ski resort with his wife and two children on Thursday without anti-avalanche safety equipment.
"I think it's a miracle," Alexandre Grether from the PGHM rescue team told the France 3 local news channel, adding that the man was found 2.5 metres below the surface.
The chances of survival after more than 20 minutes in an avalanche are usually slim.

news title: Girl buried under Pakistan avalanche for 18 hours is found alive
content summary:
MUZAFFARABAD, PAKISTAN (REUTERS) - A 12-year-old girl was found alive on Wednesday (Jan 15) after being buried for 18 hours when an avalanche in Pakistan-controlled Kashmir engulfed the family house.
Samina Bibi recalled screaming and shouting for help as she lay trapped in a room under the snow.
For Samina's mother, Shahnaz Bibi, who lost a son and another daughter, the rescue was nothing short of a miracle.
After being pulled out of the snow earlier, Shahnaz said she and her brother, Irshad Ahmad, had given up hope of finding Samina alive.
"We didn't hear a rumble," Shahnaz said, recalling the moments before the avalanche buried the three-storey house where she and her family were sheltering with others from the village.

news title: Rescuers comb Austrian, Swiss avalanches in case of victims
content summary:
VIENNA (REUTERS) - Rescuers hunted for possible victims of three avalanches that hit the Austrian ski resort of Ankogel and one at the Swiss resort of Andermatt on Thursday (Dec 26), injuring at least two people.
After a large avalanche spilled onto the piste at Andermatt, two people were pulled from the snow and taken to Uri hospital with minor injuries, Swiss police said.
In Austria, three avalanches came down in Ankogel in the province of Carinthia, police said.
One happened outside the secured ski slope and buried two free riders, who were able to escape.
The avalanche warning level had also been at three on a scale of five, according to Carinthia's warning service.

news title: Nepal rescuers call off search for trekkers after new avalanches
content summary:
KATHMANDU (REUTERS) - Rescuers in Nepal called off efforts on Monday (Jan 20) to find seven people, including four South Korean trekkers, after fresh avalanches hit the Annapurna region where the group went missing last week, an official said.
A military helicopter flew an army search and rescue team and sherpa climbers to the area, but "bad weather, heavy snow and continuous avalanches" prevented them from landing.
"Rescuers are on standby for a fresh search."
Avalanches and bad weather had also prevented a search on Sunday by seven rescuers from the Trekking Agents' Association of Nepal, who reached the site at Deurali, about 150km north-west of the capital, Kathmandu.
A helicopter equipped with a device to track signs of the trekkers in the snow also failed to pinpoint where the group of seven went missing, said an official of a private rescue company.

news title: 21 more bodies recovered in avalanche-hit Pakistan-administered Kashmir
content summary:
Rescuers were racing against time to reach scores of people believed still to be trapped inside their homes, buried under avalanches triggered by heavy snowfall in Pakistan-administered Kashmir.
The worst affected area was Kashmir's Neelum Valley, where the 21 bodies were retrieved, said Mr Ahmad Raza Qadri, a minister for disaster management.
He said that since Sunday, 76 people have been killed in Pakistan-administered Kashmir in weather-related incidents.
Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan flew to Kashmir on Wednesday to visit the avalanche-hit areas.
He visited a military hospital in Muzaffarabad, the capital of Pakistan-administered Kashmir, where several people, including women and children, were being treated after being rescued from Neelum Valley and elsewhere.

news title: Death toll rises to 28 in eastern Turkey avalanches: Officials
content summary:
ISTANBUL (REUTERS) - Two avalanches in eastern Turkey have killed 38 people, most of them buried by the second downslide while working to rescue victims of the first, officials said on Wednesday (Feb 5).
Turkey's Disaster and Emergency Authority (AFAD) said 33 people were killed when the second avalanche hit while they were searching for two more victims of the first snowslip, which killed five people, after rescuing eight others.
Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said conditions in the area made it difficult for rescue vehicles to operate, adding that a vehicle had been pulled out from under 4-5m of snow.
He later said that rescue operations had been put on hold as authorities feared a third avalanche in the area.
He told Ihlas News Agency from hospital that some 200 people were working in the rescue operation but many were out of the immediate area when the second avalanche hit on Wednesday.

news title: French man killed in avalanche on Japan ski mountain
content summary:
TOKYO (AFP) - The body of a French man was found on Friday (Jan 31) after an avalanche struck a northern Japanese mountain where he was backcountry skiing with seven other French citizens, local police said.
The death of Mr Sylvain Lethier, 38, was confirmed after a rescue team found his body off the slopes of the Tomamu ski resort in the northern Hokkaido region, a brief police statement said.
The avalanche happened on Thursday afternoon, when the group of eight went off the resort's ski courses to venture into the untouched snow on the mountain.
Seven of the group were able to descend on their own by Thursday evening after the avalanche, leaving Mr Lethier, who was "unconscious and in critical condition", according to a local fire official.
The Hokkaido region boasts powdery snow that is popular with skiers.

news title: Snow hampers search for 7 missing after Nepal avalanche

KATHMANDU • Heavy snow, chilling winds and poor visibility hampered yesterday's search for four South Koreans and three Nepalis caught in an avalanche in the popular Annapurna region of the Himalayas.
The missing group was near the Annapurna base camp around 3,230m above sea level when the avalanche struck after heavy snowfall last Friday.

ROME (AFP) - An avalanche on Saturday (Dec 28) killed a 35-year-old woman and two girls, one of them aged seven, in the Italian Alps near the border with Austria, media reported.

news title: Policy tweaks can prevent supply avalanche
